name: loq - SQL Log Analysis
description: SQL-based log analysis and query building for a cross-platform MS Log Parser 2.2 replacement
longDescription:
loq is a comprehensive Claude Code plugin for building and debugging SQL queries against log files and structured data. It provides expertise for loq, a cross-platform replacement for Microsoft Log Parser 2.2 built in Rust.

**Key Features:**
- `/loq` command for quick SQL query building and debugging
- Expert agent for complex migrations from MS Log Parser, VBScript, and VB.NET
- Support for 30+ input formats (CSV, JSON, W3C, IIS, Syslog, EVTX, PCAP, S3)
- Support for 15+ output formats (CSV, JSON, SQLite, PostgreSQL, Charts)
- Full SQL support including JOINs, CTEs, window functions, and UNION
- .NET, Python, Go, and Ruby integration guidance
- 2-5x faster performance than MS Log Parser 2.2

**Use Cases:**
- Build SQL queries for log analysis and troubleshooting
- Migrate existing MS Log Parser scripts to loq
- Integrate loq into .NET, Python, or other applications
- Debug complex queries with JOINs and window functions
- Convert between data formats (CSV to JSON, logs to SQLite)
- Analyze IIS logs, Windows Event Logs, Syslog, and more

The plugin includes comprehensive documentation references for SQL syntax, functions, input/output formats, CLI options, and language bindings.

Building complex queries with JOINs and window functions

features.name: Quick Query Building

features.name: Multi-Format Support
features.description: Work with 30+ input formats including CSV, JSON, W3C, IIS, EVTX, Syslog, PCAP, and S3

features.name: Advanced SQL
features.description: Build complex queries with JOINs, CTEs, window functions, and UNION operators

features.name: Language Integration
features.description: Guidance for integrating loq with .NET (C#), Python, Go, Ruby via FFI

features.name: Documentation Access
features.description: Direct access to comprehensive SQL, function, and format documentation
